reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is my first time reading a book by Ibáñez and what an incredible storyteller she is. I have never been to Egypt, yet, Ibáñez made me feel like I was there with Inez. The imagery used to describe the settings was so vivid. I could see the colors, feel the wind and hear the sounds. I think that is what makes a good book, good. Aside from that this book is ubique, I know I say this a lot but, but I really can't compare it to anything I have seen before.Now, let me talk about that ending without giving spoilers. That ending oh my god. I just couldn't stop myself from screaming "Noooo Whit" I can't wait for the second one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A flawless example of the YA genre
reviews.reviewText: This was a 4-star and not a 5-star for me only because it was YA, and I'm not *exactly* within that target demographic. BUT, if you're reading the book synopsis and wondering if you, a fellow 30+ year-old, still want to read this, I strongly recommend you do. This book convinced me that I can still enjoy YA; that's how amazingly it was written.In this story, we Follow Inez, an 18-year-old venturing from Argentina to Egypt to discover the truth behind her parent's death. Isabel Ibañez did a genuinely stunning job in this book of both giving us a strong, determined female lead we can root for but also reminding us that this takes place in another time where that was not necessarily seen as a good thing and brought with it it's own set of challenges.The magic system was such a refreshing take on hidden magic within our world; instead of magic linked to people, it's connected to objects, with some of those having unique (and funny) abilities.The romance: There IS a romance in this book, and while it does help drive the story, it isn't the focus. The romance is a cute, slow-burn that focuses on the tension between the two characters. This is true YA, there is no spice. It is appropriate for the 12-17 age range, and I would have loved it at that age.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I need the second book ASAP!!!
reviews.reviewText: This was such a good book! And now I have to go back and reread it to see what I might understand better after that ending… I need the second book now! The story is clearly not over, but the betrayal at the end was unforgivable, and I am choosing to believe that it is not what it seems, I have to because I can’t reconcile what he did!I really loved feeling like I was transported back in time to 1884 Egypt, it was magical. And Inez was such a strong character who wasn’t going to let the fact that she was a women hold her back in that time either. Her banter with Whit was also amazing, only because she didn’t hold back like was proper for the time. Their snarky attitudes and comebacks were so easy back and forth (it really did remind me of the banter in The Mummy, Brendan Fraser of course, there is only one correct answer). She truly surprised him with her forwardness. They had all the tension, the forbidden romance, forced proximity, he has a haunting past and secrets (which we still don’t know about), she manages to get past his defenses to see beyond the guard he puts up.I don’t want to give too much away, but Inez has to travel to Egypt after she learns that her parents have been pronounced dead after disappearing in the dessert on a dig. She has to get answers to what happened, and nothing is as it seems in this book. She ends up traveling to her uncle, who worked on the archaeological digs with her parents, and helps him search for Cleopatra’s tomb. It was filled with action, and suspense, and a mystery that is still needing to be solved in book two!“I missed his touch even though I hadn’t felt it”“You can’t just pretend that you don’t feel it. What exists between us.”“Because I want one memory with you dancing. One thing that’s mine before we part ways. … One thing I can carry with me back home”

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I want an ending to a book that wraps up most of the storylines. There is no ending to this book. You must need to read the second book to know what happens. Very disappointing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars this has everything. murder! hidden tombs! magic! mystery!
reviews.reviewText: “While I studied each one, I couldn’t help hoping that I would paint something that might be worth saving, something that would outlive me.”AHHHHHH WHAT?!?!🚨⚠️ possible spoilers this is going to be chaotic. 🚨⚠️i am unwell. INEZ WHAT ARE YOU THINKING should be the whole blurb. i couldn’t put this down. did i finish it at work? if you’re my employer, no of course not i was diligently reading emails and answering phone calls. there was a “touch her and die” moment and i was literally kicking my heels and squealing.this has everything. murder! hidden tombs! magic! mystery! if that’s not enough for you i don’t know what will be. it’s pitched as the mummy meets death on the nile and hoooo boy does it hold up. i will be thinking about this for a long time which is good since we have no release date for book two. say a prayer for me.anyways. it’s incredibly written, there’s character development, a heroine who is very much like evelyn from the mummy. whip smart and little too independent for her own good. i love her. there’s a rake who’s forbidden to fall for her. cleopatra!! i figured out one twist but there are so many other plot lines that don’t feel quite tied up so i cannot wait for book 2.also. a small detail: the chapter numbers were in spanish and we know that inez is most comfortable speaking in spanish even though she’s incredibly talented and speaks multiple languages, it’s just a very nice touch that makes you feel like she really is the narrator. if that makes sense.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The characters were well-rounded and interesting. I loved Inez as a MC- she was so fun! The magic was interesting and the hints of Cleopatra's life were fun, too!The only reason I knocked down a star was that the pacing wasn't always consistent and there were a few parts where I was tempted to skip ahead.Overall, it was a fun read that I would absolutely recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Archäologie in Ägypten mit Romanze, was will man mehr?
reviews.reviewText: Sehr tolles Buch, ich warte gespannt auf den zweiten Teil!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The start was slow and hard to get into. It seems like some poor bratty girl who wants to be free from being wealth.... not my thing. But this was anything but. It was an adventurous mystery with a subtle but punchy romance. Ate up every word.
Very thrilling, a mix between The Mummy and Death on the Nile.Read it pretty fast and i'm now expecting a release date for the next one.

If you were to describe this novel in one word, it would be “wistful.” I read this book in a single night, because I simply could not put it down. The book has been marketed toward fans of “The Mummy” and it’s such a clever comparison, because this novel captures the romance and adventure of a period piece, much like the film does. I cannot wait for rest of the story.
